title: P0420 - Catalyst Deterioration/Decrease In Efficiency - Bank 1

body.body: P0420 - Catalyst Deterioration/Decrease In Efficiency - Bank 1
P0420 - Catalyst deterioration/decrease in efficiency - Bank 1 - Fault - CM8; CR8; CS8; DBB; DCB; DR5; DS5; DTB; DUB; DVB; DWB; HF8; HG8; HJ8; HK8; HL8; LJ2; LK2; YE1; YF1; YM1; YN1
: When conditions are met within a drive cycle the engine control module tests the catalyst efficiency, and if the efficiency is judged to be low, a pending DTC is stored.
If three sequential catalyst monitor tests fail, the DTC is stored, and the MIL is illuminated.
- Damaged or leaking exhaust system excessive odour from the silencer
- Engine misfire or lack of power after warm up
Make sure the diagnostic tool is using the latest software version.
View and note 'freeze-frame' data if available.
: The catalyst efficiency is only tested once per qualifying drive cycle; therefore, it can take multiple journeys over several days for the DTC to display.
